name: Tynamo
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 10 Barriers
Timer: Adds 7 Tynamo after 1 move. Adds 10 Barriers after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Rayquaza]/
[Gengar]

Excadrill, Krookodile,
Golurk, Marowak

Gliscor

Landorus T+L, Groudon
clearingStrategy:
The added barriers are not a huge 
problem in the beginning, M-Gengar
can manage them.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless, no need to bring Tynamo
with you. Moves +5 will guarantee this
if you find yourself short all the time.

name: Squirtle
disruptions:
Board: 2 columns of Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Barrier every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
The barriers in the middle are a bit
problematic. I recommend that you skill
swap Raikou to Barrier Bash+ if you
have not done it yet, it is very helpful in
this batch of stages.

With Raikou Barrier Bash+, you can
remove the barriers quite fast. Zekrom
for damage, Shaymin to maybe trigger
Sleep Charm and get bonus damage.
Mega can be candied Rayquaza 
or Gengar, both work.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Well, with M-Rayquaza it's doable itemless,
but you need quite the luck with the combos.
I was always 2 moves short, so I threw in a
Moves +5 to get it.

name: Phanpy
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Phanpy in the middle
Timer: Adds Phanpy and Rocks every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Swampert]/
[Rayquaza]/[Gengar]/
[Sceptile]

Milotic, Avalugg, Phanpy,
Roserade

Walrein, Mamoswine,
Suicune

Kyogre, Bellossom,
Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
It's actually very helpful to bring
Phanpy to beat this stage. Walrein and
Kyogre are also helpful to remove some
rocks. In the end, this should be an
easy stage to beat. Candied M Ray or
Gengar shine again here.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Bringing Phanpy is recommended, but you
might still need a Moves+5 if the combo
gods are not on your side.

name: Eelektrik
disruptions:
Board: Barriers in row 5
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Eelektrik after 2 moves. Adds 6 Metal after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Rayquaza]/
[Gengar]

Excadrill, Krookodile,
Golurk, Marowak

Gliscor

Landorus T+L, Groudon
clearingStrategy:
A bit of a tough stage to beat itemless.
The disruptions can really mess you up.
M-Garchomp can remove some of
them, but it takes a while to evolve 
(unless candied).

Overall still beatable itemless, but
if you struggle, a Disruption Delay will
be a huge help.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay alone can do this.
As always, Moves+5 is a safety net.

name: Seel
disruptions:
Board: Seels, Barriers and Metal
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
Once again, Barrier Bash+ Raikou is
helpful here, so if you have a spare
Skill Swapper, you should use it on
Raikou.

For example: C3-E4, E4- C2 and then
D4-B2 opens one column. From there
you can open also columns 1 and 3,
and with the new icons open the others.
Then, you will have some leftovers
Seel, but they will fall down so don't
waste a move matching them.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Possible itemless with BB+ Raikou,
else you will need a Moves+5 to get this.

name: Charmander
disruptions:
Board: None 
Initial: None 
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks and 1 Charmander
after every move
recommendedParty:
[Swampert]/[Gyarados]/
[Garchomp]

Krookodile, Milotic,
Golurk, Tyranitar

Suicune, Gliscor,
Terrakion

Palkia, Landorus T+L,
Gigalith
clearingStrategy:
The stage is not hard, Tyranitar
can always eject the only Charmander
spawned.

M-Swampert water team also works fine
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless, either with M Gyarados
or Rayquaza or Gengar.
But again, it is reliant on combos to be 
achieved, so Moves +5 can be your saviour.

name: Chikorita
disruptions:
Board: None 
Initial: Adds 4 Metal and 1 Barrier 
Timer: Adds 4 Metal and 1 Barrier every 
2 moves  
Pattern: . M . / MBM / . M .
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Blaziken]/
[CharizardY]/[Rayquaza]/
[Heracross]/[Scizor]

Avalugg, Ninetales,
Volcarona, Scyther

Genesect, Delphox,
Entei, Mamoswine

Kyurem, Reshiram,
Talonflame
clearingStrategy:
Talonflame is really helpful here.
And you can bring it in a full fire team,
with Char Y or Blaziken as Mega.
Charizard Y will be able to take care
of the disruption, while Blaziken will
not.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left

Quite challenging to do itemless, 
especially if Block Smash+ misses the 
50/50. Moves +5 is recommended.

name: Dewgong
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Barriers after 3 moves. Adds 3 Metal after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
Take Zekrom with you to be able to
remove the Metal that will bother you.
If you don' thave it, you should still
take a Block Smash+ with you.
Here again, it is really helpful to have
Raikou with Barrier Bash+ (did they do
this on purpose??!)

Bellossom or Shaymin helps delay the
disruptions, and gives you room to
breathe.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Change of strategy, this S rank is doable
with Moves +5 only using M Sceptile,
Bellossom, Shaymin and another grass
type. With some luck, Dewgong will never
disrupt, and you will wipe the board multiple
times with M Sceptile.

name: Donphan
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal and 2 Barriers
Timer: Adds 4 Metal and 2 Barriers every 4
moves

HP≤4000: Adds 4 Metal+ 2 Barriers or 6 
Metal after every move
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Swampert]/
[Rayquaza]/[Gengar]/
[Sceptile]

Milotic, Avalugg, Phanpy,
Roserade

Walrein, Mamoswine,
Suicune

Kyogre, Bellossom,
Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
The disruptions hit hard, but the stage
is still doable.
Here also, you can skill swap Suicune 
to Block Smash+ to have a super
effective one!
Palkia takes care of the Barriers.

With that you should beat the stage
without items, provided that your team
is levelled properly (around 8 at least).
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

I managed to do this one itemless with
Suicune and Palkia, The disruptions are
not that bad because they are every 4 turns,
you can bring Bellossom with Mind Zap and
never have any disruptions.

Moves +5 should be enough if you trigger
Mind Zap.

name: Eelektross
disruptions:
Board: Barriers in row 5
Initial: Adds 4Mega Effects: Erases Pokémon and disruptions around three spots you tap. Metal
Timer: Adds 4 Metal every 3 moves

HP≤9000: Adds 4 Barriers every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Rayquaza]/
[Gengar]

Excadrill, Krookodile,
Golurk, Marowak

Gliscor

Landorus T+L, Groudon
clearingStrategy:
Almost the same stage as Eelektrik,
and just as annoying. Golurk is
nice to remove the Metal. Other than
that, there is not much else to do than
just dealing damage.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 (10.25?) moves left

DD is also probably needed here, so that
you can afford not to bring Golurk but a
higher power pokémon instead.

name: Wartortle
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal and 8 Barriers, V shape
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers and 2 black clouds
on row 1 every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
Did someone say that a Barrier Bash+
Raikou was helpful there too?
Seriously, do yourself a favour and 
swap that skill.

Full grass team like in the screenshot 
is not optimal, due to the lack of
Barrier Bash+ or Block Smash+.

Zekrom and Raikou are your friends
here, and with them the stage is 
beatable itemless.

Without Raikou, you might want to take
a Moves +5 maybe.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

WIth optimal team this is doable with only
Moves +5 (candied Rayquaza is part of
that optimal team).

name: Geodude
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds some Metal
Timer: Adds some Rocks after 3 moves. Adds some Metal after 1 move. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Sceptile]/
[Swampert]/[Steelix]

Conkeldurr, Roserade,
Milotic, Aggron

Gallade, Suicune, 
Virizion, Cobalion

Shaymin, Landorus T+L,
Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
This stage is not hard. With Dialga,
Gallade or Suicune to clear the
Metaln you have a wide variety of
choice. M-Gengar will take care of
the rest.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless.

name: Charmeleon
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal and 8 Charmeleon
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal and 2 Charmeleon
every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Swampert]/[Gyarados]/
[Garchomp]

Krookodile, Milotic,
Golurk, Tyranitar

Suicune, Gliscor,
Terrakion

Palkia, Landorus T+L,
Gigalith
clearingStrategy:
This stage is not that simple.
Suicune Block Smash+ helps here, as
well as Tyranitar's Eject.
Still doable itemless with a strong team
but you may want to get a Moves+5
or a Disruption Delay if you are in
trouble.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

I did it with Mega Start Garchomp, because
I thought it would clear the initial board.
It does not! But, with Mega Start and Moves
+5 using M Garchomp, it still works well.

name: Bayleef
disruptions:
Board: Rocks and Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers after 3 moves. Adds 12 Rocks after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Blaziken]/
[CharizardY]/[Rayquaza]/
[Heracross]/[Scizor]

Avalugg, Ninetales,
Volcarona, Scyther

Genesect, Delphox,
Entei, Mamoswine

Kyurem, Reshiram,
Ho-Oh
clearingStrategy:
This one is also a pain. The initial
board is problematic, and the 
disruptions will replicate the barrier
part and the rock part.

Still beatable itemless with some luck,
but honestly a Disruption Delay saves 
so much trouble here.

Maybe Reshiram + Entei skill swapped
works well in a Pyre team here.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 with
M-Blaziken team is good.

name: Graveler
disruptions:
Board: 
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 5 Metal and 5 Rocks every 4
moves
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Sceptile]/
[Swampert]/[Steelix]

Conkeldurr, Roserade,
Milotic, Aggron

Gallade, Suicune, 
Virizion, Cobalion

Shaymin, Landorus T+L,
Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
Quite difficult stage. You can bring
Bellossom and Shaymin to almost
turn off the disruptions, and with that
and M Sceptile the stage works out
quite well.

There is also Quake from Groudon,
that you can combine with Dialga
or Suicune.

If not, Disruption Delay!
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 is enough when consistently
triggering Sleep Charm / Mind Zap,
having them skill boosted helps.

If not, Moves +5 and Disruption Delay
will take care of this.

name: Eevee
disruptions:
Board: 5 Eevee, 5 Metal, 2 Rocks and 2 Barriers!
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Eevee after 5 moves. Then, adds 1 Eevee every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Little sweet Eevee has quite a
bad starting board. Machamp and
Gallade are your friends here.

Other than that, not much to add.
It heavily depends on your ability to
quickly clear the initial board, after
that it gets easier.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Moves +5 can do this alone. If itemless
you realise that you always fall off short,
then have Mega Start Medicham wreck
the initial board and the rest.

name: Snorunt
disruptions:
Board: Barriers in heart shape
Initial: Adds 7 Snorunt
Timer: Adds 7 Snorunt every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Blaziken]/[CharizardY]/
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mawile]

Aggron, Tyranitar,
Conkeldurr

Gallade, Entei, Arcanine

Reshiram, Machamp,
Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Try to clear as many Snorunt as 
possible with your first move, then
destroy everything with M Gengar.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless. Pray that the initial
Snorunt are not very bothering.

name: Espurr
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 12 Rocks and 4 Espurr every 3 moves
HP≤4000: Adds 12 Barriers and 4 Espurr 
every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]/[Rayquaza]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina (O), Pinsir,
Darkrai, Hoopa
clearingStrategy:
If Darkrai triggers Sleep Charm,
this stage becomes very easy.

Not much to add, if you don't have 
Darkrai then aim for Absol and Mind
Zap to beat this itemless.

Else, a Moves +5 might be needed.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Moves +5 is a safe purchase here.

name: Gulpin
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 black cloud and 1 Gulpin 
every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak,
Golurk

Gliscor, Bisharp

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Black clouds are annoying. Uxie can
help delay the disruptions.
Other than that, the stage is not
hard. M Garchomp or M Mewtwo Y
with Psychic team are both good.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable with only Moves +5 if your 
Mewtwo Y is candied.
Else, you may need more luck to avoid
spending another item.

name: Mega Tyranitar
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 6 Metal and 6 Tyranitar in rows
1-2
Timer: Adds 6 Metal and 6 Tyranitar in rows
1-2 every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Sceptile]/
[Swampert]/[Steelix]

Conkeldurr, Roserade,
Milotic, Aggron

Gallade, Suicune, 
Virizion, Cobalion

Shaymin, Landorus T+L,
Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
No added support for this Mega
battle, it's quite a relief.

The disruptions hit quite hard though,
so unless Groudon or Shaymin or
Bellossom delay them consistently,
you better buy a Disruption Delay
to crush this stage.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 will do this.
Skill boosted Groundon/Bellossom can
avoid you buying the DD, but you never
know with % activation...
ability: Mega Effects: Erases Pokémon and disruptions around three spots you tap.

name: Frillish
disruptions:
Board: 8 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Barriers every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Banette]/
[Absol]/[Sharpedo]

Zoroark, Weavile,
Mandibuzz

Yveltal, Malamar,
Bisharp, Honchkrow,
Hydreigon

Giratina (O), Darkrai,
Hoopa
clearingStrategy:
After M Tyranitar, this stage will seem
very easy.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless. Pray that the initial
Snorunt are not very bothering.

name: Hawlucha
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal after 3 moves. Adds 3 Metal after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Gardevoir]

Braviary, Salamence,
Deoxys, Togekiss

Xerneas

Lugia, Cresselia, Victini,
Mesprit, Uxie
clearingStrategy:
Uxie can delay the disruptions in
a M Mewtwo Y team. Deoxys can
replace the metal in case Uxie messes
up. Overall an easy stage.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless when delaying the 
disruptions, but you can add a Moves +5
if you're not confident in RNGesus.

name: Umbreon
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal and 8 Umbreon all Barriered
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Umbreon after every move. The Umbreon is placed on the Metal block, starting top left and going clockwise
recommendedParty:
[Heracross]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Pangoro,

Gallade, Genesect,
Xerneas

Diancie, Machamp
clearingStrategy:
The Umbreon will slowly disappear
as the disruptions hit. Make sure
to match only in columns 4-5-6
for the first move, else not all
Umbreon from the top left will
disappear.

Don't bring Machamp, and don't 
acitvate Gallade either. Beatable
itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless, Moves +5 as safety net.

disruptions:

Genesect, Delphox,

Kyurem, Reshiram,
Ho-Oh
srankingStrategy: Moves: At least 7 moves left

Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
C6-E2 first move

Then it's quite easy.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless, Moves +5 will
basically guarantee this.

srankingStrategy:

name: Swalot
disruptions:
Board: 12 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Rocks after 3 moves. Adds ? after 1 move. Repeat
recommendedParty:

Golurk

Gliscor, Bisharp

Cresselia, Victini,

srankingStrategy: Moves: At least 7 moves left

name: Jellicent
disruptions:
Board: Tons of Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Banette]/
[Absol]/[Sharpedo]

Zoroark, Weavile,
Mandibuzz

Yveltal, Malamar,
Bisharp, Honchkrow,
Hydreigon

Giratina (O), Darkrai,
Hoopa
clearingStrategy:
Hoopa will help a lot with the barriers.
The disruptions will be super annoying,
adding Metal sometimes in the barriers

Disruption Delay is a good option to
beat this stage, without it it proves to
be quite hard.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 are a must
have for this one.

name: Meowstic
disruptions:
Board: Pre defined
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 male Meowstic and 3 female
Meowstic every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]/[Rayquaza]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina (O), Pinsir,
Darkrai, Hoopa
clearingStrategy: C2-D2 first move clears everything.
srankingStrategy: Moves: At least 6 moves left

name: Slakoth
disruptions:
Board: Pre defined
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Slakoth every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
In 2 moves you can remove the
starting board.
Forgot to screenshot it, so it will be
available later. TO clear, do the + 
shape combos on the top first then in 
the bottom.

Stage is doable itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless.

name: Totodile
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal and 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Metal every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
BARRIER BASH+ RAIKOU!
And Zekrom is also helpful for the
initial board, and the later disruptions,
but focus on the barriers in the first
place.

Shaymin and Bellossom can again
delay the disruptions. You can go
M Sceptile or candied M Ray, still
works with Raikou in the team.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Difficult to pull off without a Moves +5.

name: Pidgey
disruptions:
Board: 4 Barrierd Metal and 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal after 2 moves. Adds 5 Barriers after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Ampharos]/
[Manectric]/[Tyranitar]

Avalugg, Magnezone,
Barbaracle

Terrakion, Mamoswine,
Walrein

Kyurem, Thundurus,
Gigalith
clearingStrategy:
As if there were not enough Pidgeys
on Pokémon GO.
And, what an annoying starting
board. Zekrom and Raikou, ONCE
AGAIN.

If you can activate Block Smash+ early
then it won' tbe that hard to beat
the stage itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless, Moves +5 always
helps depending on the results of your 
itemless tries..

name: Venipede
disruptions:
Board: 12 Rocks and 4 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Barriers after 3 moves. Adds 1 Barrier after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Aerodactyl]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
Reshiram bring a lot of relief in
this one. Emboar will do ok if you
don't have Reshiram.

Stage is beatable itemless, destroy the
barriers when they are spawned and
that's basically the strategy.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

You will probably need a Moves +5 for this
one as the amount of HP is quite high.

name: Ivysaur
disruptions:
Board: 8 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds some Rocks after 2 moves. Adds more Rocks after 1 move. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Glalie]/[Blaziken]/
[CharizardY]/[Rayquaza]/
[Heracross]/[Scizor]

Avalugg, Ninetales,
Volcarona, Scyther

Genesect, Delphox,
Entei, Mamoswine

Kyurem, Reshiram,
Ho-Oh
clearingStrategy:
The game is trying to give us reasons
to Skill swap Entei. But you don't need
that to beat this stage.

Doable itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Moves +5 really helps on this one.

name: Croconaw
disruptions:
Board: 6 Metal and 6 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Metal every 3 moves

HP≤9000: Adds 4 Metal or fill row 5 with
Metal every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
Bad board to start with. Zekrom can
help with that.
Try putting Croconaw to sleep a bit
with Shaymin, else this becomes
quite the challenge.
Still beatable itemless, but not with 
a big margin.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves +5 alone can do this, with Shaymin
or Bellossom to delay the disruptions, and
Zekrom to clear the board.

name: Minccino
disruptions:
Board: 12 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
The barriers are a bit problematic,
but if you clear the top first, the rest
will combo itself at some point
and then it will be fine.

Doable itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless with some combos,
else Moves +5 helps get this.

name: Whirlipede
disruptions:
Board: Metal in row 2 and column 2
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Metal and fill row or column 5 with Metal every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Aerodactyl]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
It is quite a hard stage, and the 
amount of Metal disrupted is insane.

Talonflame can't really handle all of
this by itself. Charizard Y is a better
choice of Mega than Blaziken to help
clear.

Not sure how doable itemless it is,
because I went Mega Start Aero
the second time I tried this stage,
in order not to hear about it again.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

I went bananas and did Mega Start Aero
with Moves +5, very easy that way.

name: Vigoroth
disruptions:
Board: 4 Vigoroth surrounded by 8 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 1 Vigoroth and 5 Barriers every 3 moves (in row 1 or 5 or column 1 or
5)
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
A hard stage. Without Disruption Delay
you will suffer. Machamp is useful to
eject the Vigoroth away.
But there are a lot fo barriers, and no
super effective Barrier Bash+.

Maybe it's worth considering bringing 
a Barrier Bash+ for this one.

Or better, go directly for the S rank 
strategy.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay, Moves +5, and Mega
Start using M-Rayquaza, and your best
fighting type pokémon.

Less that that is too risky to get the S rank
consistently.

and 3. Only match on top of them
before that.

C5-E2? C2-E2 is the correct first

Doable itemless after the correct first move.
The disruption arrives when it's too late to
S rank, so it's not an issue.

Quite a hard stage. Disruption Delay
is not mandatory, but greatly helps
if you're unlucky with Talonflame.

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 are
necessary for this S rank.

centre, and then you'll be set for

name: Audino
disruptions:
Board: 4 Barriers and 12 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Rocks every 3 moves
(in columns 1-2 or rows 1-2)
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Stage is not that bad despite the
bad looking starting board.

Just match near the rocks and it will
be fine.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless, and again Moves +5 if
you see that you fall off a bit short itemless.

name: Poliwhirl
disruptions:
Board: 6 Metal and 8 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Metal after 4 moves. Adds 7 Metal after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Sceptile]/[Ampharos]/
[Gengar]/[Rayquaza]

Magnezone, Roserade,
Gogoat

Raikou, Venusaur,
Luxray, Virizion

Shaymin, Thundurus,
Bellossom
clearingStrategy:
Bad starting board, and bad disruption
on top of it. BB+ Raikou and Zekrom, 
once again, prove to be the perfect duo
for this stage.

Shaymin or Bellossom can complement
in order to give you some breathing
room with the disruptions.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 (10.25?) moves left

You can rely on Sleep Charm or Mind Zap
to not have any disruptions, but honestly
DIsruption Delay and Moves +5 is the
safest bet to S rank this stage without
trouble.

name: Quilava
disruptions:
Board: Weird smile of Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Rocks after 2 moves. Adds the initial board after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Swampert]/[Gyarados]/
[Garchomp]

Krookodile, Milotic,
Golurk, Tyranitar,
Flygon

Suicune, Gliscor,
Terrakion

Palkia, Landorus T+L,
Gigalith
clearingStrategy:
Bringing Gliscor/Flygon helps a lot
here. Other than that, the stage is
not terrible, with proper rock breaking
you should beat this stage itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable with Moves +5 only.

recommendedParty:

Kyurem, Thundurus,

No need to say that Zekrom and
Barrier Bash+ Raikou are key to
wreck this stage.

Doable itemless regardless.

Doable itemless with the proper pokémon.
Else, you may need a Moves +5 if you're
missing one of them.

name:

(Unbound)
disruptions:

Initial: None

My advice is to go full item after
one try itemless. You will understand
why you need a full item run.

trouble.

Take with you M Rayquaza and your best
